ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would highly recommend this course to any student with the appropriate math/engineering background and even a mild degree of interest in computational modeling. It provides an excellent overview of the computational modeling of biological systems, including how the models are designed, constructed, validated, and interpreted, and their applications in furthering our understanding of biological systems and generating new hypotheses.

Fantastic introduction into the world of Multiscale Modelling. Students should be aware that a lotof topics are covered and hence not everything can be covered in depth. A more advanced follow up course would be awesome

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I learned extensively about computational modeling and how it can be used to further the understanding of biological systems, generate new hypotheses, and optimize the design of artificial systems. I find computational modeling approaches to be fascinating and powerful, and I definitely intend to incorporate them into my research.
